gammaBetaMc

Class GammaGlobal_hybrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gammaBetaMc.GammaGlobal_hybrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GammaGlobal_hybrid
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class perform a hybrid method (Monte Carlo and analytical) for global (gross) gamma efficiency calculation.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 19 Apr. 2009
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                            double y2,
                            double x)
        Linear interpolation
        Parameters:
        x1 - first point x-value
        y1 - first point y-value
        x2 - second point x-value
        y2 - second point y-value
        x - desire point x-value
        Returns:
        desire point y-value

      • getCylinderRandom2

        private static double[] getCylinderRandom2(double delzup,
                                           java.lang.String[] wtype,
                                           double[] wthick,
                                           double e_inci)
        Computes random coordinates and direction cosines for Sarpagan (Cylinder) geometry. It also computes particle weight based on attenuation in window volume and the straight line path through the source.
        Parameters:
        delzup - delzup, the detector gap or upper inactive volume thickness. For a symmetric detector it is roughly (detector_totalHeight-detector_crystal_height)/2
        wtype - wtype, multiple window materials
        wthick - wthick, multiple window thickness
        e_inci - e_inci used in computing the weight
        Returns:
        the result

        public static double[] solvewinAtt(java.lang.String[] s,
                                   double e_inc)
        Given incident energy, this routine reads attenuation coefficient table and compute the actual window attenuation coefficients for multiple window materials and using linear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        s - s
        e_inc - e_inc
        Returns:
        the result

      • getMarrinelliRandom2

        private static double[] getMarrinelliRandom2(double deltazup,
                                             double deltazdown,
                                             double deltaxy,
                                             java.lang.String[] wtype,
                                             double[] wthick,
                                             double e_inci)
        Computes random coordinates and direction cosines for Marinelli geometry. It also initialize particle weight and computes the straight line path through the source.
        Parameters:
        deltazup - deltazup, the detector gap or upper inactive volume thickness. For a symmetric detector it is roughly (detector_totalHeight-detector_crystal_height)/2
        deltazdown - deltazdown, similar with deltazup, it is the distance from bottom active detector to bottom detector.
        deltaxy - deltaxy, similar with deltazup, it is the distance from side active detector to side detector.
        wtype - wtype, multiple window materials
        wthick - wthick, multiple window thickness
        e_inci - e_inci used in computing the weight
        Returns:
        the result
